intro: Melissitus tianschanicus, commonly known as the Tianshan honeybee plant, is a flowering plant native to the Tianshan mountain range in Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-shaped inflorescence. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive aromatic scent. Melissitus tianschanicus is adapted to high-altitude environments, showcasing resilience to cold and arid conditions.
